title: Reinforcement Learning-Based Approach for Optimal Control of Nonlinear Dynamic Systems

context.prior_knowledge: Control theory, dynamic system modeling, and introductory reinforcement learning
context.additional_context: A course focused on equipping practitioners with nonlinear system control skills applicable to real industrial settings

learning_goals: Learners can explain the principles of extremum-seeking techniques for solving optimal control problems in nonlinear dynamical systems.
Learners can design approximate optimal controllers using reinforcement learning-based value function estimation methods.
Learners can implement algorithms in simulation environments that solve optimal control problems without parameterization of system dynamics.
Learners can quantitatively evaluate performance improvements by applying reinforcement learning-based control strategies to industrial case studies.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
